author: Sarah Holder, David Fox, Rachael Lewis-Krisky
description: The latest on Turning Point USA founder Charlie Kirk’s death and a turning point in the political movement he helped create.
title: Charlie Kirk Mobilized a Generation of Conservatives. What Happens to His Political Footprint After His Death?

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: Brazil’s Supreme Court sentenced Jair Bolsonaro to 27 years and three months in prison for plotting a coup after his 2022 defeat, making him the first former president convicted of such a crime in a nation long scarred by successful and failed power grabs.
title: Bolsonaro Sentenced to 27 Years in Prison for Plotting Coup

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Catherine Lucey
description: President Donald Trump said he intends to attend the funeral for conservative activist Charlie Kirk, who was shot and killed at an event on a college campus in Utah.
title: Trump Says He Will Attend Funeral for Slain Ally Charlie Kirk

author: Alex Wickham
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer faces a further challenge to his authority after Labour lawmakers put a former cabinet minister he sacked on the ballot in the party’s deputy leadership election.
title: UK Minister Fired by Starmer Seeks Comeback as Party Rival

author: Catherine Lucey
description: President Donald Trump said incursions by Russian drones into Polish airspace could have been a “mistake,” but also expressed his frustration with an incident that has alarmed Warsaw and other NATO allies.
title: Trump Says Russian Drone Breach May Have Been a ‘Mistake’

author: Joe Sobczyk
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at how the killing of Charlie Kirk has elevated security concerns in Congress. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Kirk’s Killing Has Lawmakers Fearful for Their Own Security

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: Northrop Grumman Corp. has delivered a second B-21 stealth bomber for flight tests, according to the Air Force.
title: Second Northrop B-21 Stealth Bomber Ready for Flight Tests

author: Alex Campbell
description: On Thursday, the government announced Mandelson’s dismissal, citing emails that were the subject of a Bloomberg News investigation.
title: Key Takeaways From Peter Mandelson’s Emails With Jeffrey Epstein

author: Georgia Hall
description: Several historically Black colleges and universities placed students and staff under lockdown on Thursday, citing potential threats a day after conservative activist Charlie Kirk was shot and killed at Utah Valley University.
title: Black Colleges Lock Down Amid Threats After Charlie Kirk Killing

author: Harry Wilson
description: At 3:36 p.m. London time on Monday, Bloomberg News sent a 2,000-word email to Peter Mandelson, then Britain’s ambassador to the US, seeking comment on emails he had exchanged with Jeffrey Epstein.
title: The Story Behind the Story of Mandelson’s Epstein Emails

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: A majority of judges on a Brazil Supreme Court panel found Jair Bolsonaro guilty of attempting a coup after his 2022 election defeat, making him the country’s first former president convicted of such a crime.
title: Brazil’s Bolsonaro Found Guilty in Coup Case by Majority of Supreme Court Panel

author: Erik Larson, Zoe Tillman
description: President Donald Trump asked a federal appeals court to immediately pause a lower court decision blocking his ouster of Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook, the latest sign that the administration wants to put the case on a fast track to the US Supreme Court.
title: Trump Asks Court to Pause Order Letting Cook Stay at Fed

author: Philip Aldrick, Harry Wilson
description: Peter Mandelson’s advisory firm is cutting ties with him after the extent of his relationship with pedophile financier Jeffrey Epstein emerged in a cache of embarrassing emails that saw him sacked as Britain’s ambassador to the US.
title: Mandelson’s Firm Global Counsel Cutting Ties With Him After Epstein Emails

author: Antonia Mufarech
description: Chile President Gabriel Boric pushed back against the central bank’s assessment that some of his administration’s policies are hurting the labor market, marking a rare critique of the monetary authority.
title: Chile President Gabriel Boric Disagrees With Central Bank Over Labor Market

author: Alex Vasquez, Amy Stillman
description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum defended her push to slap new tariffs on Chinese imports, insisting she does not seek conflict with the world’s No. 2 economy but instead wants to protect domestic industry.
title: Sheinbaum Aims to Calm China Tensions After Tariff Plan Backlash

author: Michael Nienaber, Naomi Kresge
description: Germany’s government has decided to back a France-led proposal for a two-state solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, according to people familiar with the plan, breaking with both US and Israel after this week’s strikes in Qatar.
title: Germany to Back New York Plan for Israel and Palestine

author: Daniel Flatley
description: US tariff revenue hit a new monthly record in August, reflecting President Donald Trump’s tariff hikes, though that still left the federal government with the third-biggest deficit on record so far this fiscal year.
title: US Deficit Tracks Third-Highest Ever Even as Tariff Take Rises

author: Erik Wasson, Steven T. Dennis
description: Republicans are moving forward with a plan to fund the government past an Oct. 1 deadline without making concessions to Democrats demanding health-care policy changes, setting up a standoff that risks a chaotic shutdown.
title: Shutdown Risk Grows as GOP Rebuffs Schumer Health-Care Demands

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: Brazil’s Supreme Court convened Thursday for the penultimate day of Jair Bolsonaro’s trial on coup-plot charges, with the panel one vote short of the majority needed to convict the former president.
title: Bolsonaro Coup Trial Resumes With Final Two Judges Set to Vote

author: Patricia Hurtado, Chris Dolmetsch
description: The wife of former Senator Bob Menendez was sentenced to 4 1/2 years in prison after she tearfully blamed her husband for masterminding a plan to accept an array of lavish bribes, including cash, gold bars and a Mercedes Benz.
title: Nadine Menendez Gets 4.5 Years as She Blames Husband for Bribes

author: Jarrell Dillard
description: Lisa Murkowski, a Republican on the Senate committee that is slated to hold a confirmation hearing for the next commissioner of the Bureau of Labor Statistics, has “extreme reservations” about President Donald Trump’s nominee.
title: Republican Senator Has ‘Extreme’ Concerns on Trump BLS Pick

author: Nacha Cattan, Laura Nahmias
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams told a group of civic and business leaders that he’s conducting his own polling to decide the future of his reelection campaign, hinting at potentially dropping out just days after he vowed to stay in the race.
title: NYC’s Adams Hints at Exiting Mayoral Race as He Waits for Polling

author: Ailbhe Rea
description: The ouster of the UK’s ambassador to the US, Peter Mandelson, raises fresh questions about Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s chief of staff, Morgan McSweeney, who people familiar with the matter said was instrumental in the envoy’s appointment and spent recent days defending his position.
title: Mandelson Downfall Puts New Scrutiny on Starmer’s Chief of Staff

author: Eric Martin
description: A top State Department official said foreigners who make light of activist Charlie Kirk’s killing aren’t welcome in the US, and asked people to report any online content that does so.
title: Foreigners Who Make Light of Kirk Killing Not Welcome, US Says

author: Aaron Kirchfeld
description: Ukraine’s chief weapons procurement official said the military was “very much concerned” about the US’s changing stance on supplying aid, noting that the country needed some systems only the US can provide.
title: Ukraine Procurement Chief Rattled by Shifting US Weapons Stance

author: Gabrielle Coppola
description: Construction on a Hyundai Motor Co.-LG battery plant in Georgia that was raided by US immigration authorities is being delayed as the companies face labor shortages.
title: Hyundai Says Battery Plant Delayed After Immigration Raid

author: Ellen Milligan
description: When Peter Mandelson was appointed the UK’s ambassador to the US in February, many in the British government predicted it would end in a scandal. Mandelson, a political operator once known as the “Prince of Darkness” for his capacity for political intrigue and spin, was fired by Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Thursday after Bloomberg published a series of emails between Mandelson and convicted pedophile Jeffrey Epstein, which cast new light on their relationship.
title: Epstein Ties Dethrone UK’s ‘Prince of Darkness’ Mandelson

author: Okech Francis
description: South Sudan charged eight senior government officials including First Vice President Riek Machar with terrorism, treason and crimes against humanity, the justice ministry said.
title: South Sudan Charges Vice President Machar With Treason

author: Josh Wingrove
description: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick predicted the US will eventually reach trade deals with Taiwan, Switzerland and India, while saying South Korea has not yet formally signed the agreement it has reached.
title: Lutnick Signals Optimism on Trade With Taiwan, Switzerland

author: Janet Lorin, Liam Knox
description: A potential settlement between Harvard University and the Trump administration could call for the college to invest about $500 million to build vocational schools, Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said Thursday in a CNBC interview.
title: Trump Wants Harvard to Build Vocational Schools: Lutnick

author: Leah Nylen
description: The Federal Trade Commission ordered Alphabet Inc.’s Google, OpenAI Inc., Meta Platforms Inc. and four other makers of artificial intelligence chatbots to turn over information about the impacts of their technologies on kids.
title: Meta, OpenAI Face FTC Inquiry on Chatbot Impact on Kids

author: William Horobin
description: France’s political crisis is eroding an otherwise solid economy, leaving the country trailing the recovery in the rest of Europe.
title: France’s Political Gloom Crushes an Otherwise Resilient Economy

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: Chile’s Communist presidential candidate Jeannette Jara and right-wing rival José Antonio Kast clashed over immigration and alleged social media bots in a closely watched prime-time debate, highlighting the country’s tense political climate.
title: Chile Communist, Right-Winger Spar Over Migrants in Tense Debate

author: Catherine Lucey, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump said he would award Charlie Kirk with the Presidential Medal of Freedom, paying tribute to the political ally whose killing stunned the conservative movement.
title: Trump Announces Posthumous Medal of Freedom for Charlie Kirk

author: Myles Miller, Georgia Hall
description: Federal investigators have recovered what they believe is the rifle used to kill conservative activist Charlie Kirk during a campus event in Utah, officials said Thursday, as the manhunt for the shooter entered its second day.
title: FBI Finds Weapon Believed Used to Kill Activist Charlie Kirk

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: Top Food and Drug Administration regulator Vinay Prasad has regained his role as the agency’s chief medical and scientific officer after he abruptly departed and then came back to the agency, according to an update on the agency’s website Thursday.
title: FDA Official Vinay Prasad Regains Chief Medical Officer Title

author: Milda Seputyte
description: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko released 52 political prisoners, in the second such move this year by the close ally of Russian leader Vladimir Putin.
title: Belarus Releases 52 Political Prisoners After Renewed US Effort

author: Godfrey Marawanyika
description: Zimbabwe’s government will freeze recruitment in most of its departments next year to contain the state wage bill, the nation’s finance ministry said.
title: Zimbabwe Will Freeze Most State Hiring in 2026 to Curb Wage Bill

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: Vice President JD Vance will travel to Utah on Thursday to offer condolences to the family of Charlie Kirk, the conservative activist who was killed as he spoke on the campus of Utah Valley University, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Vance to Travel to Utah With Manhunt for Kirk’s Killer Underway

author: Jessica Nix, Madison Muller
description: A small but vocal contingent has long been demanding changes at the agency. With an ally in RFK Jr., it’s finally getting what it wants—to the horror of the scientists he’s sidelined.
title: How RFK Jr. Is Pushing the CDC to the Brink

author: Volodymyr Verbianyi
description: The International Monetary Fund has determined that Ukraine’s funding needs over the next two years may be as much as $20 billion higher than the government in Kyiv estimates as talks to secure the next aid package are set to begin.
title: IMF Sees Up to $20 Billion Hole in Ukraine Funding Through 2027

author: Patrick Van Oosterom
description: Dutch Foreign Minister David van Weel summoned Russian ambassador Vladimir Tarabrin over the drones that flew over Poland on Wednesday, his spokesperson said.
title: Dutch Minister Summons Russian Ambassador Over Drones in Poland

author: Heidi Taksdal Skjeseth
description: An ally of Norway’s re-elected Labor Party wants to see more companies linked to Israel’s war in Gaza to be sold off from the Nordic nation’s sovereign wealth fund as a condition of its support.
title: Norway’s Labor Party Ally Seeks More Oil Fund Divestments

author: Iain Rogers
description: Germany’s lower house of parliament stripped a far-right Alternative for Germany lawmaker of his immunity from prosecution as part of an investigation into alleged corruption and money laundering.
title: German AfD Lawmaker Stripped of Immunity in Corruption Probe

author: Andrea Palasciano
description: NATO is preparing a defensive military measures in response to the drone incursion in Poland to strengthen deterrence across the alliance’s eastern flank, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: NATO Working on Defensive Moves After Poland Drone Incident

author: Ekow Dontoh, Okech Francis
description: Ghana agreed to receive deportees from the US, joining a growing list of African nations accepting undocumented immigrants who are being expelled by American President Donald Trump’s administration.
title: Ghana Joins Growing Africa List Willing to Take US Deportees

author: Ailbhe Rea, Alex Wickham, Ellen Milligan
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer fired Peter Mandelson as Britain’s ambassador to Washington, following revelations about the extent of his relationship to late pedophile financier Jeffrey Epstein.
title: Starmer Fires Mandelson as Envoy to US After Epstein Emails

author: Ugur Yilmaz
description: Turkish authorities ordered the seizure of dozens of companies, including major television channels, as part of a probe into Can Holding AS, a conglomerate with assets ranging from energy to media and education.
title: Turkey Seizes Some Media Outlets as Part of Fraud Probe

author: Jeff Kao, Surya Mattu, Dhruv Mehrotra
description: Methods included cryptographic analysis, metadata analysis and corroboration with external sources.
title: How Bloomberg News Vetted the Epstein Emails

author: Jason Leopold, Ava Benny-Morrison, Jeff Kao, Dhruv Mehrotra, Surya Mattu, Harry Wilson, Max Abelson
description: A cache of 18,000 messages reveals Maxwell’s deep ties and involvement with the sex offender.
title: Epstein’s Emails Detail the Life and Crimes of the Financier—and Ghislaine Maxwell’s Leading Role

author: Fiona MacDonald, Mirette Magdy
description: Qatar branded Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu “shameful” and “reckless” after he threatened the Gulf state with further military action if it doesn’t either expel or bring to justice Hamas members on its territory.
title: Qatar Condemns Netanyahu’s ‘Reckless’ Threats of Military Action

author: Ott Tammik
description: NATO’s Baltic members sent a joint letter to the US Congress, asking for a key military financing initiative to be preserved after the Pentagon said it planned to cut funding for European nations bordering Russia.
title: NATO’s Baltic Members Urge US to Drop Plan for Defense Aid Cuts

author: Sanjai P R, Tom Schoenberg, Patricia Hurtado
description: Billionaire Gautam Adani’s efforts to get US fraud charges against him resolved have stalled, according to people familiar with the matter, prolonging the regulatory overhang that has hobbled the Adani Group’s global expansion plans.
title: Adani Bid to End Bribery Case Stalls Amid Volatile US-India Ties

author: Dan Williams, Leen Al-Rashdan
description: Israeli weapons makers have been barred from one of the world’s biggest aerospace expos in the United Arab Emirates amid rising anger in the Gulf at Israel’s Gaza offensive and an unprecedented airstrike on Qatar this week.
title: Israeli Firms Barred From Dubai Air Show as Regional Furor Grows

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: A team from the US Defense Department and Boeing Co. executives are expected to visit India next week to negotiate the sale of about $4 billion of surveillance aircraft, officials in New Delhi said, as the two countries seek to revive trade talks.
title: US Defense Team Heads to India as Leaders Revive Trade Talks

author: Miaojung Lin
description: Taiwan has approved special funding to strengthen “national resilience” that includes money for more ships and drones, underscoring a push by President Lai Ching-te to better counter China’s aggression.
title: Taiwan Approves Special Funds for Ships, Drones to Deter China

author: Lucille Liu, Yvonne Man, David Ingles
description: The head of a UK-China business lobby group expects Prime Minister Keir Starmer to visit China in early 2026 to build on closer bilateral ties since the Labour government came to power.
title: China-UK Business Council Chief Sees Starmer Visit in Early 2026

author: Colum Murphy
description: China has pushed back against Washington’s proposed new visa limits on Chinese journalists in the US, one of many sour points in relations even as a fragile trade truce appears to be holding.
title: China Opposes ‘Media Warfare’ With US on Journalist-Visa Limits

author: Galit Altstein
description: Amid scenes of destruction and hunger in Gaza and this week’s bombing in Qatar, frustrated European leaders are threatening sanctions on Israel and rethinking ties to their longtime ally.
title: Europe’s Push to Penalize Israel on Gaza Hit by Defense Need

author: Samy Adghirni
description: For all the vitriol flying around French politics in recent months, you will struggle to find anyone with a bad word to say about the new prime minister.
title: France’s New Premier Is Popular in Private, But Tarred by Macron

author: Eric Ombok
description: The United Nations is growing the capacity of its secretariat headquarters in Kenya — its only facility in Africa and already the biggest worldwide — cementing Nairobi’s position as the international diplomacy capital in the global south.
title: UN’s Largest Complex Begins Upgrades, Rivaling New York Hub

author: Soo-Hyang Choi, Heesu Lee
description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung said a US immigration raid that led to the detention of more than 300 Korean workers has unsettled companies pouring billions into America.
title: South Korea Warns US Immigration Raid May Hit Investment

author: Grace Sihombing, Claire Jiao
description: Indonesia’s new finance minister unveiled a roughly $12 billion cash injection to stimulate lending, proving his commitment to President Prabowo Subianto’s growth agenda barely two days into the job.
title: Indonesia’s New Finance Chief Moves Fast With $12 Billion Plan

author: Josh Wingrove, Jennifer A Dlouhy, Gabriel Baumgaertner
description: In the weeks after his election victory last year, Donald Trump held court with future cabinet nominees at Mar-a-Lago, flew to Paris for the reopening of Notre Dame, met the Prince of Wales and visited the New York Stock Exchange.
title: Charlie Kirk Energized Conservative Youth, Paving Way for Trump’s Rise
